name: Yallaiah Onteru
title: Java Developer & Architect
professional_summary: Utilized Java and Spring Boot to develop scalable microservices for insurance claim processing, reducing latency by 30% and ensuring HIPAA compliance.
Implemented RESTful APIs using Java and Hibernate, streamlining healthcare data integration and improving data retrieval speeds by 25%.
Engineered a Java-based fraud detection system for banking transactions, leveraging AWS Lambda for real-time processing and reducing false positives by 40%.
Developed a Java and React.js client portal for insurance policy management, enhancing user experience and increasing policy renewals by 20%.
Designed a Java-based healthcare provider network management system, ensuring GDPR compliance and improving provider onboarding efficiency by 35%.
Built a Java and Kubernetes-based containerized application for banking risk assessment, achieving 99.9% uptime and PCI compliance.
Created a Java and Python hybrid system for insurance claims automation, reducing processing time by 50% and improving accuracy.
Implemented a Java-based ETL pipeline using Apache Kafka, streamlining healthcare data ingestion and reducing processing time by 40%.
Developed a Java and Angular-based patient portal, enhancing user engagement and reducing support tickets by 30%.
Engineered a Java-based banking transaction monitoring system, leveraging Azure Event Hubs for real-time analytics and detecting anomalies with 95% accuracy.
Built a Java and Spring Batch framework for insurance policy batch processing, improving throughput by 60% and ensuring data integrity.
Designed a Java-based healthcare claims adjudication system, ensuring HIPAA compliance and reducing claim denial rates by 25%.
Implemented a Java and React Native mobile app for insurance policyholders, improving customer satisfaction scores by 40%.
Created a Java-based banking customer segmentation system, leveraging AWS Redshift for data warehousing and improving marketing campaign ROI by 35%.
Developed a Java and Python-based machine learning model for healthcare fraud detection, achieving 90% accuracy and reducing financial losses.
Engineered a Java-based insurance policy recommendation engine, leveraging Azure Machine Learning and improving cross-selling rates by 50%.
Built a Java and Angular-based banking dashboard, providing real-time insights and reducing decision-making time by 40%.

Cloud Platforms: Azure (Event Hubs, Machine Learning, Cosmos DB)

responsibilities: Architected a Java and Spring Boot-based microservices framework for insurance claim processing, reducing system latency by 30% and ensuring HIPAA compliance.

Developed a Java and React.js client portal for policy management, increasing user engagement by 20% and reducing support tickets.
Implemented a Java-based ETL pipeline using Apache Kafka and Spark, streamlining data ingestion and reducing processing time by 40%.

Troubleshot and resolved critical production issues, ensuring 99.9% system uptime and customer satisfaction.
Integrated Java applications with third-party APIs, enhancing functionality and improving data accuracy.
Automated CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins and Docker, reducing deployment time by 50% and improving release frequency.
Implemented Java-based batch processing using Spring Batch, improving throughput by 60% and ensuring data integrity.
Ensured compliance with GDPR regulations by implementing data encryption and access controls in Java applications.
Optimized Java code for performance, reducing memory usage by 30% and improving application responsiveness.
Participated in Agile ceremonies, contributing to sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives.
Documented technical designs and architecture diagrams, facilitating knowledge sharing and onboarding of new team members.
